notes.note: [Profile management][1] helps protect your privacy and stay focused by separating your online life into distinct profiles — for work, school, vacation planning, or whatever you choose. You can now name your profiles and customize them with avatars and color themes for easy recognition, then quickly switch between them — all while keeping bookmarks, tabs, and browsing history completely separate. [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/profile-management
Users in the United States can now trigger weather suggestions in the address bar! Simply type a weather-related term or a city name, and view the result directly in the address bar dropdown.

Tab Groups, a new way to organize and take control of your tabs, is now available to almost all users worldwide. You can create a group by dragging one tab onto another, pausing, then dropping it. You can also now reposition a tab group on the tab bar by dragging it.
Firefox on Windows 11 now uses acrylic-style menus for popup windows, which better match the operating system’s aesthetic.
You can now copy links from background tabs using the tabstrip context menu on MacOS and Linux.

Improved the [address and credit card autofill][1] experience to better handle forms that update dynamically as users input information. Autofill now correctly fills newly revealed fields—such as those shown after selecting a country.


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/credit-card-autofill

Rededicated previous color settings to Contrast Control settings. ([Learn more][1])


  [1]: https://blog.monotonous.org/2025/03/06/New-Contrast-Control-Settings/

Added support for [Import Attributes][1], allowing developers to specify additional metadata when importing modules.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/import/with

Applications can now set their preferred degradation method to be used when the configured frame rate and resolution cannot be maintained. ([Learn more][1])


  [1]: https://w3c.github.io/mst-content-hint/#degradation-preference-when-encoding

Firefox now enables the [cache directive][1] for the `Clear-Site-Data` header, allowing websites to clear the network cache. This gives websites more control over stored data, such as clearing the cache during logout to help mitigate privacy risks. ([Learn more][2])


  [1]: https://www.w3.org/TR/clear-site-data/#clear-cache
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Reference/Headers/Clear-Site-Data

Added support for the [import map integrity][1] field, allowing you to ensure the integrity of dynamically or statically imported modules.

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/script/type/importmap#integrity_metadata_map

Implemented support for `Error.isError`, enabling brand checks to determine whether an object is an instance of Error. ([Learn more][1])


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/isError

Added support for the `error.captureStackTrace` extension to improve compatibility with other browsers. ([Learn more][1])


  [1]: http://github.com/tc39/proposal-error-capturestacktrace
A new column has been added to the Network panel to display the full path of the request URL. This enhancement makes helps developers quickly view and analyze complete request paths.

Firefox now applies a uniform user agent (UA) style to `<h1>` elements, regardless of whether they are used inside `<article>`, `<aside>`, `<nav>`, or `<section>`. ([Learn more][1])


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements#specifying_a_uniform_font_size_for_h1

You can find information about policy updates and enterprise specific bug fixes in the [Firefox for Enterprise 138 Release Notes][1].


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/firefox-enterprise-138-release-notes

With the release of Firefox 138, we are pleased to welcome the developers who contributed their first code change to Firefox in this release, 18 of whom were brand new volunteers! Please join us in thanking each of these diligent and enthusiastic individuals, and take a look at their contributions: * Abdelaziz Mokhnache: 1932626, 1950987 * Brian Ouyang: 1950467 * Chris Shiohama: 1953971 * cob.bzmoz: 1947667, 1956149, 1956163 * Cruz Hernandez: 1947000 * erosman [:erosman]: 1869171, 1951166 * Gautam Panakkal: 1775913, 1917910 * Harold Camacho: 1935513, 1936819 * Ihar Hrachyshka: 1939555 * Jacob Wood: 1915523 * Janik Haag: 1953297 * Jishnu Murali Thampan: 1828113, 1947594 * joel.mozillaosi: 1950008 * Joshua O'Brien: 1948347, 1952022 * Luke Taylor [:ltaylor]: 1953199, 1953206 * Ngo Fong: 1953748 * Sandi Vujaković [:elsandosgrande]: 1951697 * Shane Ziegler: 1953980, 1954799, 1955586

Due to recent changes in Chrome on Windows, some users might find that the Firefox migration wizard no longer successfully imports passwords from Chrome or Chrome-based browsers. As a workaround, you can export your passwords as a CSV file from Chrome and then import them into Firefox using either the migration wizard or the Firefox password manager.

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
title: Firefox 138.0 Release
